heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 28 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 5.7°C), outside temperature (down 4.9°C), and inside temperature (down 1.8°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 46.5°C), feels like temperature (up 48.7°C), outside temperature (up 48.5°C), and cloud levels (down 176 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 275.4m higher than yesterday, 176.1m higher than the past week, 335.1m higher than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 821m and a peak of 3400m, averaging 2070m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, air moisture should feel ok and calm and still conditions are expected. Showers, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
